 news stories consisting of a 500 characters
 synopsis & a black and white image with
 accentuated focal points.

If you access the Service through a Social Networking Service, you may also be required to accept that Social Networking Service’s terms of use agreement and privacy policy. If you continue using the Service after the new terms take effect, you will be bound by the modified Privacy Policy. Children under the Age of 13. Vizo does not permit children under the age of thirteen (13) to use the Service, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 13. If we learn that we have collected or received personal information from a child under the age of 13, we will delete that information. Information We Collect. When you access the Service through a Social Networking Service, information associated with your account or profile on that Social Networking Service may be provided to us by the applicable Social Networking Service. Depending on your privacy settings for the applicable Social Networking Service, this information may include your name; gender; birthday; profile picture; contacts; device information; profile information such as biography, education, occupation, and employer; data made available by you and your friends; location; time zone; and the location of the devices you use to access the Service. You should check the privacy policy, and your privacy settings and controls, for the applicable Social Networking Service to learn more about how you can control the information collected and shared by the Social Networking Service with us. Information Received from Mobile Devices or Personal Computers. When you access the Service through a mobile device we may receive and collect information such as the type and identification of that mobile device, its location, telephone number, and mobile network information. The Application also may access metadata and other information associated with other files stored on your device. This may include, for example, photographs, audio and video clips, personal contacts, and address book information. We may also use this information to track your use of the Service and allow you to invite, or be invited by, other users to use the Application. Information You Provide to Us Directly. By accessing or using the Service, we will directly collect information about you as follows: User Account and Profile. If you access the Service through a means other than a Social Networking Service, you may be required to provide information such as your email address, name, postal address, and telephone number in order to create an account within the Service. We may also allow you to create a user profile which will be visible to other users of the Service. Such profile information may include your name and/or user name, profile picture, biographical information, information about your use of the Service, and links to profiles of you on Social Networking Services. Correspondence and User Content. If you correspond with us by email, text, or other messaging (including for support purposes), we may retain records and copies of your messages, your email address, telephone number, and our responses. We may also retain any messages you send through the Service either to us or other users. In addition, any content, comments, questions, and other information that you upload, publish, display, link to, or otherwise make available on or through the public areas of the Service (“User Content”) is considered public, may be accessed by us and other users, may be indexed by search engines or other means, and we may store such information. User Activity. When you use the Service, we may collect information about your use of the Service including but not limited to your usage, patterns of use, traffic data, location data, logs, searches resources accessed, transactions carried out through the Service, and interactions with other users. Information Automatically Collected Through the Service. Cookies. When you use the Service from a computer, we may send one or more small files called “cookies” to your computer that uniquely identify your browser and let us help you log in faster, track, and enhance your navigation through the Service. We may also use cookies to collect information about how you use the Service. Third parties that deliver advertisements to users of the Service may also use cookies, and their use of cookies is governed by their own policies and practices. You can set your web browser to refuse certain types of cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. If you set your browser to limit or remove cookies, some features of the Service may be unavailable or may not function properly. We may also engage in behavioral tracking by collecting information about your activities over time and across third-party websites, applications, or other online services. Log Files. Log file information is automatically reported by your browser or Social Networking Service each time you access the Service from your computer. We may also use log files and server logs to collect information about your use of the Service, which provides a more personal and richer user experience. These log files and server logs may include information such as your web request, IP address, browser type, referring/exit pages and URLs, number of clicks, domain names, landing pages, and pages viewed. Clear GIFs or Web Beacons: When you use the Service from your computer, and email or message us, we may employ clear GIFs (also known as web beacons) which are also small files used to track the online usage patterns of our users so that we may better understand how people use the Service, and improve the user experience. We do not share usage information with third parties, except in the form of aggregate data that does not specifically identify individual users and except as necessary to prevent illegal activities and enforce our Terms of Use Agreement. Third Parties’ Use of Cookies and Web Beacons: The Service may include third-party advertising, links to other websites, and other content from third-party businesses. These third-parties may use cookies and web beacons to track the actions of users online over time and across different websites or platforms to deliver targeted electronic advertisements to an individual user. For information about how tracking works for online advertising purposes you can visit http://www.aboutads.info/choices. Vizo does not have access to or control over web beacons or cookies that third party websites may use. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of these third-party websites. You are encouraged to review the privacy policies of the different websites you visit. In addition, some third-party advertising companies may provide a mechanism to opt-out of their technology. For more information about the opt-out process, you may visit the Network Advertising Initiative website, available at: http://www.networkadvertising.org/managing/opt_out.asp. In addition, your browser may allow you to adjust your browser settings so that “do not track” requests are sent to the websites that you visit. However, we will not disable tracking technology that may be active on the Service in response to any “do not track” requests that we receive from your browser. How We Use Your Information. General. We use the information that you provide and we collect to operate, maintain, provide, and improve the features and functionality of the Service and to create a personalized and rich user experience. In addition, we may use your information for other purposes including, but not limited to: (a) create your Service account and allow use of the Service; (b) remember information so that you will not have to re-enter it during your next visit or use of the Service; (c) update your user profile; (d) customize and personalize the user experience; (e) monitor the effectiveness of our Service; (f) monitor aggregate metrics such as total number of users, traffic, and demographic patterns; (g) notify you of Service updates or new products or promotional offers; (h) solicit feedback from you about how we can improve the Service; (i) respond to your inquiries; (j) provide technical support and diagnose or fix technology problems reported by our users or engineers that are associated with certain IP addresses; (k) help you efficiently access your information after you sign in; (l) track User Content and users to the extent necessary to prevent illegal activities, enforce our Terms of Use Agreement, and comply with applicable law; and (m) deliver targeted advertisements. By providing us with your email address, including by adding the Application on a Social Networking Service, you consent to our using the email address to send you Service-related notices in lieu of communication by postal mail, except as required by applicable law. You also agree that we may send you notifications of activity on the Service to the email address you give us, in accordance with your privacy settings. When we do this, these third parties’ use of your information will be subject to this Privacy Policy. Aggregate Information. We may share, sell, resell, or otherwise monetize information that does not identify you personally (such as anonymous aggregated data, referring/exit pages and URLs, platform types, number of clicks, and etc.) with third parties. We note that, while this information will not identify you personally, in some instances these third parties may be able to combine this information with other data they have about you, or that they receive from third parties, in a manner that allows them to identify you personally. Response to Subpoenas or Court Orders or to Protect Rights and to Comply with Our Policies. Except as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy, we will not disclose personal information to any third party unless required to do so by law or subpoena or if we believe that this action is necessary to (a) conform to the law, comply with legal process served on us or our affiliates, or investigate, prevent, or take action regarding suspected or actual illegal activities; (b) enforce our Terms of Use; (c) take precautions against liability; (d) investigate and defend ourselves against third-party claims or allegations; (e) assist government enforcement agencies; (f) protect the security or integrity of the Service; or (g) exercise or protect the rights, property, or personal safety of us, our users or others. We may occasionally provide your information to marketing partners or other third parties that may then contact you with marketing and other information about products, services, or publications in which we believe you may have an interest. You can elect to opt-out of having your information shared with these third parties either by (a) during the registration process, un-checking the box granting us permission to share your information with third parties for their own marketing purposes, (b) adjusting the settings in your user account, or (c) contacting us at help@vizonews.com. We will stop sharing your information with third parties for their own marketing purposes within a reasonable time period following our receipt of your election to opt-out. In this case, if you no longer want to receive marketing communications from the applicable third party, you will need to notify the applicable third party directly. Our Affiliates. If you visit these websites or provide any information directly to parties other than us, different policies may apply to the collection and use of your information. We encourage you to investigate and ask questions before accessing third party websites or disclosing information to third parties. Use of Information Outside Your Country of Residence.
